H0.text: Carbon dioxide is the gas transported by the circulatory system in humans and is used by cells during respiration to release energy stored in food.

H1.text: Nitrogen is the gas transported by the circulatory system in humans and is used by cells during respiration to release energy stored in food.

H2.text: Hydrogen is the gas transported by the circulatory system in humans and is used by cells during respiration to release energy stored in food.

H3.text: Oxygen is the gas transported by the circulatory system in humans and used by cells during respiration to release energy stored in food.

A4.text: Hemoglobin in red blood cells binds O2, changing color from bluish red to bright red (CO2 is released from another part of hemoglobin through the Bohr effect).

A5.text: A liter of blood can dissolve up to 200 cm3 of O2.
